Starting a charity is a significant undertaking. Here are the key factors to consider:

## Questions to Ask Yourself First

**1. Is there already an organization doing this work?**
- It may be more effective to [volunteer, donate, or partner with existing charities](https://www.charitynavigator.org/) rather than start from scratch
- Existing organizations have infrastructure, tax-exempt status, and experience you'd need to build

**2. Do you have the resources?**
- Starting a charity requires [significant time, money, and expertise](https://www.councilofnonprofits.org/running-nonprofit/starting-nonprofit)
- You'll need funding for operations before you can help others
- Legal and administrative costs can be substantial

**3. What's your specific mission?**
- Successful charities have [clear, focused missions](https://www.charitynavigator.org/guides/how-to-start-a-nonprofit)
- Vague goals like "help people" are less effective than specific objectives

## Alternatives to Consider

- **[Donor-Advised Funds (DAFs)](https://www.fidelitycharitable.org/guidance/philanthropy/what-is-a-donor-advised-fund.html)** - Give strategically without forming an organization
- **Fiscal sponsorship** - Partner with an existing 501(c)(3) to avoid administrative burden
- **Social enterprise** - Create a for-profit business with social impact
- **[Effective Altruism approach](https://www.givewell.org/)** - Research and donate to highly effective existing charities

## If You Decide to Proceed

Key steps include:
- [Forming a board of directors](https://www.nolo.com/legal-encyclopedia/forming-nonprofit-corporation-30284.html)
- Filing for [501(c)(3) tax-exempt status](https://www.irs.gov/charities-non-profits/charitable-organizations/exemption-requirements-501c3-organizations)
- Creating bylaws and governance structure
- Building fundraising capacity

**What specific cause are you passionate about?** That would help me provide more targeted guidance!
